metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6618 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The av_probe_input_buffer function in libavformat/utils.c in FFmpeg before 1.0.2, when running with certain -probesize values, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted MP3 file, possibly related to frame size or lack of sufficient "frames to estimate rate."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6618` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.2-2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.2-2').
qtwebengine-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
